metadata.title: CVE-2021-23133 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition in Linux kernel SCTP sockets (net/sctp/socket.c) before5.12-rc8 can lead to kernel privilege escalation from the context of anetwork service or an unprivileged process. If sctp_destroy_sock is calledwithout sock_net(sk)->sctp.addr_wq_lock then an element is removed from theauto_asconf_splist list without any proper locking. This can be exploitedby an attacker with network service privileges to escalate to root or fromthe context of an unprivileged user directly if aBPF_CGROUP_INET_SOCK_CREATE is attached which denies creation of some SCTPsocket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
